item.title: Keep the Peace
item.description: #mattifesto - Carter and Mondale are generally considered to be good men (a single example, and, interestingly enough, they post about MLK a bit later). That's the issue. Telling the truth? Fine and good. Obey the law and keep the peace? Not good.

item.title: Banana Slug Party
item.description: #yard - ain't no party like banana slug party cuz banana slug party don't stop

item.title: The Gospel According to Matthew Chapter 16
item.description: #gospel - That was some good loaves and fishes," said Joseph, licking his fingers as he and Mary walked back to their beach towels. "Our Boy can burn."

#ope - Finished chapters 14 and 15 of The Gospel According to Matthew....

item.title: The Gospel According to Matthew Chapter 15
item.description: #gospel - Golly Gee did mumble under his breath, "You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt lo- no. No. That won't work. Maybe... whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn the other. No. Hmmm..."

item.title: The Gospel According to Matthew Chapter 14
item.description: #gospel - Golly Gee and his crew left the Sea of Honalee and traveled two hours inland where they met a large gathering of people. Golly Gee raised his hands and said, "Most assuredly..."

#ope - Always weird when I have a Sunday/Monday off of work. Yesterday we went to Newport, OR's Nye Beach, a trendy little area with lots of shops and restaurants and art galleries. It's cool because it has narrow streets and the shops are all right up against each other and there are hidden alleys and sidewalks everywhere. When we moved out here.....

#ope - A couple few months ago I had a revelation. I was talking with my wife. I told her the world was a horrible place and I was going to be... and then there was a mental blur, a shift, a kind of visual sound?

item.title: King Tides
item.description: #pnw - Small write up on king tides from a previous iteration of this journal. Rather than integrate it into the current journal, I'm putting it here. I like it too much to leave it out but am too lazy to integrate it properly, so here it lays. The image above is The Great Wave off Kanagawa by Katsushika Hokusai.....
#pnw - The PNW is a pretty funky place to live. The Oregon Coast doubly so.....

item.title: Libs-Or Emails
item.description: A series of emails sent to Libs-Or, a "forum for sharing information about the Oregon library community."

#ope - Sick day yesterday taking care of Stacy. I was to be the driver should she have needed to go to the hospital. Neither of us thought she would need to go to the hospital, but since we're not medical professionals we thought we'd both take a day off just in case. You know, you can't be too careful with these things....

item.title: Ope...A Life: Page -7
item.description: The Echo Mountain Complex Fire took place over a week or so in 2020. This entry begins on 6 September. Not my best writing, but it's too gosh darned long to rewrite while being important enough to want to remember. Not all the links below work anymore....

item.title: Ann Telnaes
item.description: #mattifesto - I've worked for the Washington Post since 2008 as an editorial cartoonist. I have had editorial feedback and productive conversations—and some differences—about cartoons I have submitted for publication, but in all that time I’ve never had a cartoon killed because of who or what I chose to aim my pen at. Until now....
#yard #pnw - Coast Guard helicopter out of Depoe Bay responding to emergencies up and down the coast. Happens frequently on weekends and holidays. Get a great view of it from the bedroom window....

item.title: First Three Books of the Year
item.description: #books - Finished Wild Massive. Finished The Return. DNF'd The 25th Hour....
#ope #pnw - It's our 29th anniversary. We love snow. We enjoy The Shining (and The Shining and The Shining). What better place to go than Timberline Lodge on Mt. Hood?...
